title: Helmut Hediger
text:
Helmut Hediger (born 3 May 1945) is an <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n <a href="canoe%20racing">sprint canoeist</a> who competed in the late 1960s and early 1970s. He won a silver medal in the K-4 1000 m event at the <a href="1966%20ICF%20Canoe%20Sprint%20World%20Championships">1966 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships</a> in <a href="East%20Berlin">East Berlin</a>.
Hediger also competed in two <a href="Summer%20Olympics">Summer Olympics</a>, earning his best finish of seventh twice (<a href="Canoeing%20at%20the%201972%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20K-2%201000%20metres">K-2 1000 m</a>: <a href="1972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972</a>, <a href="Canoeing%20at%20the%201968%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20K-4%201000%20metres">K-4 1000 m</a>: <a href="1968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968</a>).
